oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Crystal Ice and Coal Company
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: These men and mule comprised the "work force" at Woodbury's Crystal Ice & Coal Company, circa 1931. They are, from left, Ralph Adams, Duby Orvil Conley, Robert Adams, Fred Adams, Oscar Cook, Henry Bratten, Carl Adams, Frank Adams, and Bo Batey and his mule Dick. Shows horse and carriage, antique cars and a large block of ice in front of the exterior of the Crystal Ice and Coal Company Building.

Bo Batey and his mule named Dick were the most visible agents of the ice company located on Water Street when moved from Readyville to the county seat town of Woodbury. The ice plant was located off of Courthouse Square. The animal named Dick was considered one of Woodbury's smartest mules of his time.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Ice industry; Ore industry; Factories; Automobiles; Carriages & coaches
